label: Folders 52-61: Williams Letter
description: Letter dated Jan. 27, 1945, from Porter Williams of Carolina Savings Bank [City of Charleston Alderman] to Dr. Joseph I. Waring in support of the opposition to selling the South Adgers Wharf property to a shrimpery and keeping the neighborhood residential.

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: Letter dated Jan. 27, 1945, from Porter Williams of Carolina Savings Bank [City of Charleston Alderman] to Dr. Joseph I. Waring in support of the opposition to selling the South Adgers Wharf property to a shrimpery and keeping the neighborhood residential.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value: Carolina Savings Bank  Charleston [H] S. C.  ESTABISHED   1874  HENRY P. WilliamS. Chairman of the Board  EISON A. WilliamS. President SIDNEY B. JONES. Asst Cashier  PORTER WilliamS. V-PRES. amp; CASHIER WARING P. CARRINGTON. Asst. Cashier  OUIS T. PARKER. V-PHES. ft Trust OFFICER PIERRE G. STONEY. Asst. Cashier  J. J. BONNOITT, V-P. ft Branch Mgr. THOMAS E. MYERS. Asst. Trust Officer  January 27, 1945      "  Dr. Joseph I. Waring  7 egare Street  Charleston, S. C   Dear Joe:  I acknowledge your we expressed letter protesting the seing of city property ,to a shrimpery.  I, too,  think it wise to keep that neighborhood residential, as  far as possibe.  The headines in the paper, "Counci Defers Sae of  any P.U.C. ands," setted the matter temporariy.  The  Mayor said at the meeting that there would be no action  for the time being.  There wi, I am informed, be Public  hearings, etc.  It will be we to watch the situation and have as  many personal and organizationa protests as possibe.  Thanks for writing.  Sincerey,  ijUWa, .
